verses.roman:
sei ta' puruṣa ananta-brahmāṇḍa sṛjiyā
saba aṇḍe praveśilā bahu-mūrti hañā

synonyms: sei—that; ta'-certainly; puruṣa—incarnation; ananta-brahmāṇḍa—innumerable universes; sṛjiyā—creating; saba—all; aṇḍe—in the egglike universes; praveśilā—entered; bahu-mūrti hañā—taking multifarious forms.
translation: After creating millions of universes, the first puruṣa entered into each of them in a separate form, as Śrī Garbhodakaśāyī.
